title: Howie Kendrick's Wikipedia page got hilarious update after game-winning grand slam in NLDS
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Steve Gardner breaks down how the Nationals were able to advance to the NLCS. USA TODAY

The Washington Nationals are headed to the National League Championship Series after a stunning 7-3 victory over the the Los Angeles Dodgers in Wednesday night's Game 5 of the NLDS at Dodger Stadium.

It was stunning because first they used back-to-back home runs off Clayton Kershaw in the top of the 8th to tie the game, then veteran Howie Kendrick — who previously played for the Dodgers — won it for the Nationals with a grand slam off Joe Kelly in the top of the 10th.

And just like that the team with the best record in baseball this year was done for the season and the wild-card winning Nationals advanced to face the St. Louis Cardinals in the NLCS.

It didn't take long for someone to have fun with Kendrick's Wikipedia page, as he was labeled "Executioner of the Los Angeles Dodgers."

Fans loved it:

Was trying to remember if Howie Kendrick was a dodger.....so I wiki’ed him pic.twitter.com/r3ihlRRYQ4 — Joe (@And_awaytheyJoe) October 10, 2019

That "Executioner of the Los Angeles Dodgers" reference has since been removed.

Follow For The Win's Andy Nesbitt on Twitter @anezbitt.
description: Howie Kendrick's Wikipedia page got a hilarious update after a game-winning grand slam against the Dodgers in the Nationals' NLDS Game 5 win.
